summary:
The Assassins were a secret group active in the Middle East from 1090 to 1275 AD. Founded by Hassan-i Sabbah, they lived in mountain forts and were known for their stealth and assassination skills. They targeted leaders of different faiths, including Christian and Muslim rulers. The term 'assassination' is linked to their tactics.

One famous incident involved an Assassin trying to kill King Edward I of England, likely sent by Sultan Baibars. The Assassins' base in Masyaf, Syria, was a key stronghold. Historians like Ata-Malik Juvayni documented their activities, often calling them 'batiniyya'.
title: Order of Assassins
